interestingcomments.content: Reichmann's article makes perfect sense. And I bet it works very well, IF you're photographing in situations where there's lots of light. But I don't do that. I shoot mostly in the dark. At ISO 640 and f/1.4 there's never enough light to push the histogram to the right - I'm usually underexposed, or the subject is blurred beyond recognition by the slow shutter speed. So for me, ETTR is like a unicorn: a nice idea, but mythical. Luckily, the M9 handles underexposure spectacularly well, despite the theory. --img--
